laboratory_examinations.findings: Patients designated as having anxious depression if their anxiety/somatization factor score from the HAM-D was 7 or higher at baseline.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Anxious depression patients were less likely and took longer to achieve remission compared to nonanxious depression patients.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Remission rates were lower in anxious depression (27.5%) compared to nonanxious depression (38.9%).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patients with anxious depression had higher mean QIDS-SR scores at exit and lower raw QIDS-SR change scores compared to nonanxious depression.
